p: There is a growing public interest and endorsement for the use of complementary and alternative medicines for disease management [ 212]. Commonly prescribed plant-based derivatives include opiates (e.g. morphine from Papaver somniferum) for pain relief, digoxin ( Digitalis lanata) for atrial fibrillation/flutter, and quinine (Cinchona) for malaria/muscle cramps. There are doubtless other pharmacological actions awaiting to be discovered from studying plant-derivatives and the question is, for the purpose of this review at least, do any modulate ASIC3?
